intro: Osteospermum elsieae, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense, flat clusters, and it thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Osteospermum elsieae is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and landscapes.
